headers.text: Lines where schedule is referenced or needed in Form 1040

rows.text: Itemizes allowable deductions against income; instead of filling out Schedule A, taxpayers may choose to take a standard deduction of between $6,300 and $12,600 (for tax year 2015), depending on age, filing status, and whether the taxpayer and/or spouse is blind.
Enumerates interest and/or dividend income, and is required if either interest or dividends received during the tax year exceed $1,500 from all sources or if the filer had certain foreign accounts.
Lists income and expenses related to self-employment, and is used by sole proprietors.
Is used to compute capital gains and losses incurred during the tax year.
Is used to report income and expenses arising from the rental of real property, royalties, or from pass-through entities (like trusts, estates, partnerships, or S corporations).
Is used to document a taxpayer's eligibility for the Earned Income Credit.
Is used to report income and expenses related to farming.
(Until 1986) Was used for income averaging over four years until eliminated by the Tax Reform Act of 1986.
(Since 1995) Is used to report taxes owed due to the employment of household help. Previously these were reported on Form 942.
Is used when averaging farm income over a period of three years.
(Until 2010) was used to figure an increased standard deduction in certain cases.
(2009 and 2010) was used to claim the Making Work Pay tax credit (6.2% earned income credit, up to $400).
Is used to calculate the Credit for the Elderly or the Disabled.
Is used to calculate the self-employment tax owed on income from self-employment (such as on a Schedule C or Schedule F, or in a partnership).
Additional Income and Adjustments to Income - Former lines 1-36 that were moved from 1040 with those kept on 1040 omitted.
Tax - Former lines 38-47 that were moved from 1040 with those kept on 1040 omitted.
Nonrefundable Credits - Former lines 48-55 that were moved from 1040 with those kept on 1040 omitted.
Other Taxes - Former lines 57-64 that were moved from 1040 with those kept on 1040 omitted.
Other Payments and Refundable Credits - Former lines 65-75 that were moved from 1040 with those kept on 1040 omitted.
Foreign Address and Third Party Designee
Is used to calculate the Child Tax Credit. (From 1998-2011 this was called Form 8812 rather than Schedule 8812.)
